intro: Cyrtandra × triangularis, commonly known as the triangle heliotrope, is a hybrid plant native to Hawaii. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive triangular-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, violet or blue flowers that are often clustered in umbels. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in coastal or montane habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some botanical gardens and private collections.
